title: 10 Bans might force riot to change kits that are fundamentally toxic to play against.
body:
If we get 10 bans does anyone in the 70% of the player base in bronze and silver ever expect to ever see things like {{champion:105}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:114}} ?

My hope is when the same slew of champions is universally banned, Riot might realize that a huge portion of their customers view these kits as unfun to play against.  I have always said how obnoxious something is to play AGAINST should carry more weight than how something is to play.  One person plays the champ. 5 people have to play against it.

replies.body:
Bronze and Silver trash can cry about whatever they want.
Game isn't balanced around trash who don't know how to play properly.
You can call them toxic if that makes you feel better.
Doesn't change the fact they're balanced, or trash (in Zed's case).
You know, you don't have to be aggressive about it.
It's annoying to see the same shitpost over and over.

I just tune it out, take it in stride, or joke about it most of the time. 

I rarely see the point in rank shaming. It more just strengthens the stereotype of high rank players being elitist jackasses than it does make low elo players trash.

At this point, I honestly don't mind it. Some people won't be satisfied unless Zed is quite literally made into a caster minion. Every time he comes up people act like his ult doesn't scream "THROW HARD CC RIGHT BEHIND YOU BECAUSE THAT'S WHERE I'M GONNA BE!!!!!".

He also falls off very hard by late game if he doesn't pop off, making him a "win lane, lose game" sort of guy. But because low elos only care about the lane, they think he's super strong. Only time I'm worried about Zed is when he's on my team.

>
> how obnoxious something is to play AGAINST should carry more weight than how something is to play.  One person plays the champ. 5 people have to play against it.

I agree that 10 bans is going to be great for the fun of the game, but I don't agree with this method of argument; saying it should be more important that it is unfun against than fun as. If we use that form of argument to justify changes then it is possible to end up with more champions that lost their fun mechanics just because people found them frustrating to play against.

Not saying that unfun things shouldn't be addressed, just saying that we need to be careful about how we do it.

What? eliminating bans would force them to change kits. Adding bans encourages them to ignore broken champs.

Honestly, I think it depends. RIOT might just decide that its ok for some champs to be perma-banned in low elo. The introduction of 10 bans is likely to introduce a new meta that changes based on the tier you play at. Some champs are banned in bronze but not in plat etc. I see them accepting this as it ads a bit of diversity to the champ roster depending on the level of play. This hits one-tricks who might need a champ to get through an elo that their champ is always banned in but honestly they could stand to learn something else instead of playing the same thing over and over.
The alternative solution is that when each player is equally responsible for the banning of toxic champions, that makes none of them responsible, and each player will only ban Urgot.
